intro: Polyscias gigantea, commonly known as the giant polysiaca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by dark blue or black berries. Polyscias gigantea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
